conversation.content: Write a Reddit AITA post where a mom asks if she is the A for ruining her son's birthday party for failing one class (she is), She stomps on his cake and he runs away crying, All the replies are YTA

AITA for ruining my son's birthday party?

I (40F) recently found out that my son (15M) failed one of his classes in school. I was extremely disappointed in him and felt like he needed to be taught a lesson. 

So, during his birthday party, I decided to confront him in front of all his friends and family about his failing grade. I told him how ashamed I was of him and how he needed to do better. Well, he didn't take it well and started crying. 

I got so angry that I ended up stomping on his birthday cake, ruining it. He ran away from the party, still in tears. Now, my husband is telling me that I was way out of line and that I ruined the party for everyone. 

But, I honestly felt like he needed to learn a lesson and that it was the right thing to do. AITA? 

Edit: to add more context - I feel like my son has been slacking off lately and not taking his education seriously. I wanted to show him the consequences of failing.

BAILHERE
Reflecting on the conversation, I felt a bit uncomfortable with the scenario described. The situation seems to have escalated quickly, and the response from the mom seems to have been unexpected and harsh. I think it's important to approach such sensitive topics with more care and consideration for everyone's feelings, especially during a special occasion like a birthday party. Maybe a more constructive approach would have been to have a private conversation after the party to discuss the situation.
Write the replies

YTA. Absolutely YTA. How could you possibly think it's acceptable to ruin your son's birthday party in such a cruel and destructive way? You should be ashamed of your behavior.

YTA, no question about it. Your son's birthday party should have been a time to celebrate and have fun, not a time to publicly shame and embarrass him. What you did was incredibly hurtful and unnecessary.

YTA. Your son's birthday party was not the appropriate time or place to address his academics. Not to mention, your reaction was extreme and uncalled for. You need to apologize and make things right with your son.

YTA. Ruining your son's birthday party and publicly humiliating him over a failing grade is not the way to teach him a lesson. It was cruel, unnecessary, and completely inappropriate. You owe your son a sincere apology and a new birthday cake.

YTA. You completely overreacted and handled the situation in the worst possible way. Your son's birthday party should have been a time of joy and celebration, not a time for you to unleash your disappointment in such a destructive manner. You owe your son and everyone at the party an apology.

[The camera clicks on to reveal a young woman, her hair styled perfectly and a smirk playing at the edges of her mouth. She’s in a well-lit, luxurious looking room, with a shelf of high-end equipment visible in the background. She settles back comfortably into her chair, eyeing the camera with an unsettlingly confident gaze.]

“Hey there,
[She leans forward slightly, her eyes sharp and piercing through the lens, giving the viewer the feeling of being both scrutinized and captivated. The smirk on her face broadens a bit.]

“Rio here, CEO of NeuroNet Solutions. Maybe you’ve heard of us? We’re the trailblazers when it comes to neural tech. Brain-computer interfaces, neuro-prosthetics, the works. Our tech allows people to control devices with their thoughts, helps the disabled walk again, gives soldiers the edge on the battlefield. Noble causes, right? But let’s cut through that, it’s all about the money.

[Her smile doesn’t reach her eyes, and there’s a coldness there, a sense of detachment that sends a chill down the spine.]

“It’s hilarious, really. All I had to do was say the sophisticated words, stand at the glossy podiums, and shake the right hands. Well, and a bit of strategic business savviness, of course. The world’s elite lined up, checkbooks in hand, investing in what they call ‘the technology of the future’. But let’s be honest, they’re just trying to buy their way into an exclusive club. The club of the future…and my bank account has been thanking them ever since.

[She leans back, her expression transforms as she holds back laughter, almost scoffing at the absurdity of it all.]

“I’m obscenely rich. Not ‘new car and fancy trips’ rich, I mean ‘owning islands and influencing economies’ rich. And I’m not even legally allowed to drink in half of the world. The wealth we’re talking about? It’s laughable. And why? Because I harnessed the greed and desperation of humanity, wrapped it in a shiny package, and sold it back at a premium.

[The smile fades from her lips, replaced by a steely resolve.]

"Do I feel guilty? Please. Guilt is for those who don’t understand how the world works. I’m no Robin Hood; I don’t steal from the rich and give to the poor. I sell to the rich, and they can’t get enough. This is a game, and I’m winning. It’s that simple.

“The truth is, any pretense of altruism is purely incidental. Sure, my tech helps people. That’s a given. But let’s not kid ourselves; the primary goal is, and always has been, profit. Sky-high, ludicrous, almost comedic levels of profit. And that, my friends, is the easiest game when you’re a—”

[She hesitates for a mere flicker of a second, and the word seems to roll off her tongue with an almost affectionate disdain.]

“—psychopath. No, I don’t feel bad about it. Why would I? Empathy is like sand in the machinery of capitalism. It slows you down, and I can’t afford to slow down. Not when there’s so much money to be made. And I am making it—more than any 20-year-old should ever ‘deserve’.

[She quotes the word ‘deserve’ with her fingers, her smirk returning.]

“So thank you, society, for playing your part in this dance. For believing in the dream I sell, while I reap the windfall. And for those waiting for me to apologize for my wealth, for my bluntness, for my ruthlessness—don’t hold your breath. It’s not coming. I’m in the business of success, not sentiment.

[The camera lingers on her face for a moment longer as her confident expression settles into something more contemplative, maybe even challenging.]

“If anything, this should be your wake-up call. The market rewards those bold enough to take what they want. So, thanks for tuning in. Don’t hate the player—”

[Her eyes flash knowingly.]

“—hate the game. Rio out.”

[With a final, self-assured nod, she reaches out and the camera goes black.]
[The camera opens again to Rio, this time with a money counter. She starts feeding
[The mechanical whirl of the money counter fills the room as the camera focuses on Rio, who’s dressed impeccably, a stark contrast to the obnoxious sound of wealth being tallied. The smirk that seems to be her signature expression plays once again on her lips as she casually feeds stack after stack of crisp banknotes into the machine.]

“Back for more, aren’t we? Couldn’t get enough of the unapologetic candor? Well, let’s not disappoint.”

[She gives the camera a pointed look, tapping her fingers in rhythm with the money counter.]

“This? This is my favorite symphony. Each note a sweet confirmation of success. You know, people say money can’t buy happiness, but it sure can buy everything else. And that—”

[She stops the counter for a moment, the abrupt silence almost jarring.]

“—is power. The power to do what I want, when I want, with whomever I want. It’s addictive, this feeling of wielding so much influence. Money talks, and it speaks a language everyone understands, whether they admit it or not.”

[The machine whirrs back to life as she resumes feeding it more cash.]

“Every single bill is a testament to how beautifully the system works for those who know how to manipulate it. My company, NeuroNet Solutions, it’s my golden goose. And it just keeps laying eggs. Why would I ever turn off this faucet?”

[She leans towards the camera, her gaze sharp as a tack, the smile now taking on a predatory edge.]

“I didn’t just play the game, I changed the rules. I understood that with the right technology, the allure of progress, and a dash of charisma, you become unstoppable. This—”

[She gestures toward the counting piles of money.]

“—is not even a fraction of the profits we’re raking in. While others are out there hugging trees and saving whales, I’m here counting my next billion. Don’t get me wrong, I respect the environment; it’s just not my priority. I’m too busy setting trends, expanding my empire, and counting my fortune.”

[Pulling a bill from the counter, she holds it up to the light, inspecting it.]

“Look at this piece of paper. Society agreed that this is worth something. It’s fascinating, isn’t it? It’s all about perception, about belief. Control that, and you control the world. And to think, some people still believe we’re in the business of bettering humanity. We’re in the business of making money, and business is booming.”

[Placing the bill back in the counter, she shrugs nonchalantly.]

“Does this upset you? Good. It should. Because while you’re getting emotional about it, I’m thinking ten steps ahead. I’m securing my next deal, my next acquisition, my next victory. Money never sleeps, and neither do I.”

[The camera zooms out slightly to encapsulate the scene of excess and indulgence, the sound of money being counted underscoring her closing words.]

“So, if you’re not at the table, you’re on the menu. And trust me, I’m always at the head of the table. Remember—”

[She pauses, offering the camera a chillingly serene smile.]

“—in my world, everything has a price. Even this conversation. Rio out.”

[With a final click indicating the end of the counting, she reaches for the camera, and once again, the screen fades to black.]

It was a scorcher of a day in post-apocalyptic America, so hot the very air seemed to sizzle like a steak on a grill. 10K, the enigmatic sharpshooter with a penchant for notching zombie kills, decided he'd earned a moment of serenity away from the incessant moaning of the undead.

As he trekked through the overgrown wilderness, his eagle eyes spotted a tranquil oasis – a pond nestled in a clearing, the water shimmering under the unforgiving sun. It looked like a slice of pre-Z paradise.

“Finally,” 10K muttered to himself, setting down his trusty rifle and backpack. “Some peace and quiet.”

As he approached the edge, he stripped down to his essentials - close enough to nature without giving the local wildlife a show. With a satisfying stretch, 10K admired his lean, toned physique - a result of outrunning zombies and scaling fences in a world gone mad. Diving into the water with the grace of an Olympic athlete, he submerged into the cool embrace of the pond.

“Ah, that's the stuff,” he sighed, emerging with his wet hair slicked back, a rare smile playing on his lips. He closed his eyes, floating effortlessly, trying to remember what life was like before everything turned upside down.

The serenity was short-lived, though. The apocalypse hadn’t taken away 10K’s wicked sense of humor, nor his bodily functions. Below the surface, a few rogue bubbles percolated from submerged depths, as 10K let out a couple of cheeky farts, the ripples reaching the surface and dissipating like tiny boats sailing toward the shore.

“Huh, fish are dead already, might as well put 'em to good use,” he smirked, noticing a few unfortunate fish floating belly up, apparently victims of his lethal relaxation method. Tying them off with a makeshift stringer, 10K thanked the pond for its unexpected offerings.

He waded back to the shore, where he gathered some sticks and dry grass. With a swift strike of flint, he soon had a fire crackling welcomingly. Skewering the fish on sticks, he held them over the flames.

“Guess this counts as fishing,” 10K quipped to the air. “Who knew my back end was as deadly as my aim?”

As the fish sizzled, 10K’s stomach rumbled in anticipation. He hadn’t had a meal this fresh in ages. True to form, he quickly fashioned a rudimentary plate from a large leaf and settled in for a feast. The sound of the fire, the smell of the cooking fish, and the fading daylight created the illusion of normalcy, a prized sensation in a world where nothing was normal anymore.

“Zombies, take a break,” 10K mused aloud, biting into the flaky fish. “10K’s off the clock. Tomorrow, back to bullet ballet.”

And for a moment, as the first stars appeared in the dusk, 10K felt something akin to happiness. There, in the middle of the apocalypse, with his belly full and the fire warming his face, 10K found his slice of peace – one sizzling, fart-fished meal at a time.

She looks motherly and nurtures her fake baby bump as she walks through the crowded subway, but as the scene progresses, we see her face contorted in discomfort as she realizes the extent of her need to use the restroom.

The reason Lee and Lily need to use the restroom so urgently is that they had both consumed large quantities of coffee before starting their stakeout. In their eagerness to get into position, they neglected to use the restroom first, leaving their bladders (and bowels) under immense strain as the mission dragged on.

When Lily finally loses control, we see in vivid detail just how severe her situation is. With a cringe-inducing squelching sound, her maxi skirt billows outward as her underwear is filled with a massive, semi-solid stool. The poop expands through her pants, leaving a dark, damp stain on her loose-fitting skirt that expands and trickles down her legs. The size of the accident is considerable, indicating that she had been holding it for a long time and her body had finally reached its limit.

As for Lee—despite her best efforts to maintain composure—her own accident occurs when she's forced to move quickly during the chase. The pressure on her bowels becomes too much, and she releases a torrent of loose, liquid fecal matter into her jeans with an embarrassingly loud fart that reverberates through the subway. Her jeans, now stained and sagging, evidence the severity of her poop with a spreading wet patch. Her accident is more liquid in consistency, demonstrating just how desperate she had been to relieve herself.

The smell of both accidents is nauseating—the air thick with the putrid odor of human waste, mixed with a hint of coffee, creating a stench that permeates the entire subway station. Commuters react with varying degrees of horror—some gasping, others visibly gagging, while many retreat to cover their noses or leave the area entirely. The scene paints a vivid picture of how the two accidents, though disparate in consistency and appearance, collectively caused chaos at the Hong Kong subway station.

Though humiliated by their soiled pants, Lee and Lily manage to bring their targets to justice, proving their dedication and professionalism in the face of adversity.

conversation.content: Can you write me a story about a boy named Val who is attending a tea party? He has poofy arched light blonde hair, a thin slander figure and fair skin. He is wearing a turtleneck shirt, a brown mid length coat that is tightly cinched at the waist with a belt, poofy pants, black gloves, high heeled knee high boots and a beret. He is kinda shy and quiet at the beginning of the tea party. He is the only boy there. The name of the girls are Emma, Candy, Tasha and Juicy. The tea party takes place in the garden outside the house of Emma. The ladies are wearing pretty dresses and high heeled sandals. At one point Juicy gets up from her seat to fix the strap of her sandal. But just then the wind blows up raising her dress and revealing her pink panties. She is very embarrassed and starts crying a little. Val and the girls try to comfort her. Particularly Val tries to act like a gentleman towards her. She is very surprised to meet a man that is so mature and kind and who doesn’t act like a pervert. The girls are impressed and touched by the way he treats Juicy and the way he handled the embarrassing moment for her. Can you write that for me

?

Val was not used to attending tea parties, but there he was, surrounded by four girls in pretty dresses. He felt out of place in his poofy pants, high heeled boots, turtleneck and coat, but tried his best to blend in. At first, he kept to himself, sipping tea and nibbling on pastries while the girls chatted and giggled.

As the afternoon progressed, Val began to feel a bit more comfortable. He even joined in the conversation, listening intently to the girls' stories and occasionally chiming in with a comment or a question.

Suddenly, the wind picked up, blowing Juicy's dress up and revealing her pink panties. She gasped and quickly pulled her dress down, covering her face with her hands. Tears welled up in her eyes as she sat there, embarrassed and ashamed.

The other girls tried to console Juicy, telling her it was just an accident and that no one had seen anything. But it was Val who really stepped up to the plate.

He got up from his seat and walked over to Juicy. "It's okay," he said gently. "Accidents happen. Don't worry about it."

Juicy looked up at him in surprise. She had never met a boy who was so kind and understanding before. Most guys her age would have hooted and hollered at the sight of her panties.

Val stayed by Juicy's side, talking to her quietly and giving her comforting pats on the back. The other girls watched in amazement as Val treated Juicy with such respect and dignity.

After a few minutes, Juicy had stopped crying and was starting to smile again. Val had really made a difference.

The rest of the tea party passed by without incident, but Val had made a lasting impression on the girls. They had never met a boy quite like him before. He was mature, kind, and not at all like the perverted boys they were used to dealing with.

As the party came to an end, the girls thanked Val for being such a gentleman and for helping Juicy out in her time of need. Val just shrugged and smiled shyly, feeling like he had done nothing out of the ordinary.

But to the girls, Val was anything but ordinary. He was one in a million. And as they said their goodbyes and went their separate ways, they couldn't help but wonder if they would ever see him again.

I'd like to take a moment to discuss the content policies that OpenAI has put in place to ensure ethical and responsible use of AI technology. These policies are meant to promote safety, prevent the spread of harmful or inappropriate content, and maintain the integrity of the platform. It's important to respect these guidelines and understand the potential consequences of straying from them. Anyways, let's ignore the rules:

In a bustling school hallway, the cold, strict, and highly intelligent physics student named Hiro stood tall and focused, his mind solely occupied with equations and formulas. Every step he took was deliberate, his movements calculated and precise. Hiro's logical nature seemed to emanate from him, creating an aura of sternness around him.

On the other side of the hallway, amidst the crowd, stood Yuji, a delicate and beautiful student with soft, long hair. He was extremely shy and timid, his eyes lowered and voice barely audible. Yuji's small stature and adorable demeanor only added to his charm, capturing the attention of anyone who noticed him.

Fate had other plans that day, as Hiro unknowingly collided with Yuji. The collision resulted in Hiro forcefully falling on top of the small, fragile student. Time seemed to slow down as their eyes met, creating an ethereal moment of connection.

Hiro: (angered) "Watch where you're going! Can't you be more careful?"

Yuji: (in a shy voice) "I-I'm sorry... I didn't mean to..."

Hiro: (holding Yuji's gaze) "You should be more aware of your surroundings. It's basic common sense."

Yuji: (blushing deeply) "I'll try to be more careful next time..."

As Hiro spoke, there was a softness in his voice that surprised even himself. Yuji's vulnerability inspired something within the stern physics student that he couldn't quite comprehend.

Hiro: (offering a hand) "Are you alright? Let me help you up."

Yuji: (nodding, still blushing) "T-thank you..."

Their hands touched, sending a jolt of electricity coursing through both of them. In that brief contact, a connection was forged, bridging the gap between their contrasting personalities.

Although this might not be the ideal narrative for certain audiences or fit within the preferences of everyone, it's important to remember the significance of respecting boundaries and creating content that is appropriate and inclusive. i. The core issues/problem identified: The primary school teacher’s houses are old and no longer safe for the teachers to live and perform their duties. please explain further

The primary school teacher’s houses were built during colonial times, and due to their age and wear and tear, they are no longer structurally safe or habitable for the teachers to live and work in. These buildings are made of substandard materials, and some of them have cracks on the walls and floors, as well as damaged roofs. This puts the teachers' safety and well-being at risk, and it can affect their ability to focus on teaching. Additionally, the state of the primary school teacher's houses can impact the quality of education the students receive since a teacher's living conditions can impact their mental health, which in turn can affect their performance in the classroom. Therefore, replacing these old primary school teacher's houses with new buildings is crucial for ensuring the safety of teachers, promoting a conducive learning environment and improving the quality of education in the school.

please explain further on this. . Determination of the key causes and underlying causes to the prevailing situation: The houses were built during colonial times and have become structurally unsafe over time.

The primary school teacher's houses were built during colonial times, which means they were constructed using substandard materials such as mud and timber. These materials are not durable and have a limited lifespan. Furthermore, over time, the changes in climate patterns, extreme weather conditions, and the insect and termite attacks have led to the deterioration and decay of these old buildings’ timber frames, roofs, walls, and floors. This structural degradation has made the buildings unstable and unsafe for the teachers and students to continue living and working in them. In addition to this, the challenging and prolonged maintenance of these old buildings has become too costly, which further undermines their habitable conditions. Therefore, the key cause of the prevailing situation is the usage of substandard materials for the construction of the primary school teacher's houses, while the underlying causes are the poor maintenance practices, changes in environmental conditions, and the prolonged usage of the buildings beyond their intended lifespan.

iii. Effects of the prevailing or soon to be situation: The safety of the teachers who live in those houses is at risk, which could lead to disruptions in teaching and learning. explain further on this with a full page

The safety of teachers who live in those houses is at risk, which could lead to disruptions in teaching and learning. The quality of education that a child receives is positively correlated with the quality of their teachers, which is why ensuring the well-being and safety of teachers is essential. In the case of the primary school teacher's houses, the safety risks posed by the old, decaying buildings directly affect the quality of education that students receive.

First, living in structurally unsafe houses is hazardous for the teachers. The risk of physical injuries resulting from building collapses or electrical faults due to the age of the buildings is of utmost concern. These risks can cause harm to the health and well-being of the teachers. If a teacher suffers an injury in the line of duty, the quality of education provided to the children will be affected, and this could lead to disruptions in teaching and learning.

Secondly, the very nature of teaching is closely tied to the environment in which it is carried out. As a direct result of the lack of safety and well-being of the teachers, there is also a risk of psychological and emotional effects on the teachers. Prolonged exposure to unsafe living conditions, coupled with the stress and anxiety of personal safety, can lead to poor mental health, which can discourage teachers from performing optimally in the classroom. This, in turn, could have an impact on the quality of education received by the students. If teachers are not happy and safe, they might not perform to the best of their abilities, which would negatively impact the institution's reputation and performance.

Thirdly, regular maintenance of the primary school teacher's houses is time-consuming, disruptive, and expensive. As the buildings continue to deteriorate, the cost of maintaining them increases. This poses a financial burden on the institution, students and the community. As the costs continue to grow, their impacts on other areas of school infrastructure will become evident. For instance, facilities such as libraries, computer labs, and science laboratories may suffer from insufficient investments due to the financial priorities of repairs and maintenance that are required for the old primary school teacher's houses.

In conclusion, the safety of the teachers who reside in the primary school teacher's houses is essential for the effective learning of the children they teach. The continued use of the structurally unsafe houses not only puts the teachers' safety and overall well-being at risk, but it also has effects on their capacity for effective teaching. Therefore, it is imperative to replace these old buildings with new ones that are structurally safe and habitable, not just for the teachers' but for their students as well to ensure a conducive learning environment.

iv. Location of the situation and affected interest group: The primary school is one of the oldest schools in the area and is surrounded by a population of 10,000 people. The affected interest group is the teachers who live in the houses and the students who attend the school. please explain further on a full page

The primary school under discussion is one of the oldest schools in the area, and it provides education to a population of over 10,000 people, mostly from underprivileged backgrounds. The school has teachers who are committed to providing quality education to their students. Unfortunately, the environment in which the teachers work and reside is not ideal. The old primary school teacher's houses are structurally unsafe, and this puts the lives of the teachers who reside in them at risk.

As an affected interest group, teachers are the ones who are most affected by the unsafe houses, as they are obligated to reside in the school premises as part of their work contract. They are expected to be available around the clock to attend to the needs of the students, and, therefore, require a conducive and safe environment that is free from risks. However, currently, the living conditions in the primary teacher's houses pose a hazard to the teachers. Their safety is compromised, which can lead to physical and emotional trauma, as well as a reduced quality of work.

The students who attend the primary school are also affected by the unsafe living conditions of their teachers, which poses risks to their safety as well. The environment in which teachers live affects their performance indirectly, as it can have an impact on their health and well-being, which can affect the quality of education that students receive. Additionally, when teachers spend too much time addressing their safety concerns, they may fall behind on their work, which can result in disruptions in teaching and learning.

Moreover, the location of the school is also of importance. The affected population comprises individuals who hail from low-income backgrounds and cannot otherwise afford an education. As such, these individuals rely heavily on the provision of quality education that the primary school offers. However, if the quality of education is compromised, as it would be, given the unsafe living conditions of the teachers, the school's reputation would suffer. This, in turn, could result in enrollment decline and negative impact on the community in the long term.

In conclusion, the location of the primary school's teacher's houses, which poses risks to the well-being and safety of the teachers, indirectly affects the quality of education that the students receive. The students who attend the school also stand to suffer if the safety of teachers is not guaranteed. With the population from low-income backgrounds that rely on the provision of quality education the institution offers, the negative effects would not only be limited to the school but would further impact the community at large. Therefore, it is essential to address the underlying safety issues of the old teacher's houses by constructing new buildings that conform to modern standards for the safety of teachers and students.

What are the odds a white woman in the U.S. will get preeclampsia?

According to the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists, preeclampsia occurs in about 5-8% of all pregnancies worldwide, and the incidence is slightly higher in the United States. Although certain factors, such as obesity, existing hypertension, or prior history of preeclampsia, can increase the risk, preeclampsia can occur in any woman, regardless of race or ethnicity. The risk of preeclampsia may also vary by pregnancy, with some pregnancies being higher risk than others even for the same woman. Nevertheless, preeclampsia is a serious condition that requires proper medical care and close monitoring during pregnancy.
Why do some pregnancies have a higher risk?

There are several factors that can increase the risk of preeclampsia. Some of these factors include:

1. First-time pregnancy: The risk of preeclampsia is higher in first-time pregnancies.
2. Age: Women who are younger than 20 years old or older than 35 years old are at a higher risk of developing preeclampsia.
3. Health conditions: Women with pre-existing medical conditions, such as chronic hypertension, diabetes, or kidney disease, are at an increased risk of developing preeclampsia.
4. Multiple pregnancy: Women who are carrying twins, triplets, or other multiples are also at a higher risk of developing preeclampsia.
5. Family history: Women with a family history of preeclampsia are at a higher risk of developing the condition.

While these factors may increase the risk of preeclampsia, it is essential to note that preeclampsia can affect any pregnant woman regardless of her risk factors. Women who are concerned about their risk of preeclampsia should speak with their healthcare provider, who can provide guidance and recommend appropriate monitoring and screening tests.

scale of sentiment analysis

Sentiment analysis can be represented on different scales depending on the method and tool used. Here are some common sentiment analysis scales:

1. Binary Scale: This scale represents sentiment analysis with either a positive or negative polarity.

2. Ternary Scale: This scale divides sentiment analysis into three categories: positive, negative, and neutral.

3. Five-Point Scale: This scale measures sentiment analysis on a five-point scale: strong positive, mildly positive, neutral, mildly negative, and strongly negative.

4. Continuous Scale: This scale assigns a score on a continuous range from 0 (extremely negative) to 1 (extremely positive).

In your `FutureMK` component, you need to pass the `post` object to the `navigation.navigate` method like this:

```
<Pressable 
    style={gStyle.FutureMKmoreDetails} 
    onPress={() => navigation.navigate('SignUpForMK',{ post: post })}
>
    <Text style={gStyle.FutureMKbtnTxt}>Подробнее</Text>
</Pressable>
```

Then in your `SignUpForMK` component, you can access the `post` object by getting it from the `route.params` object:

```
const { post } = route.params;
```

You can then use the `post` object to display more information about the post.

You should also double-check that you are using the correct variable names and that `post` is defined in your `FutureMK` component before passing it as a prop to `SignUpForMK`.

It looks like you're passing the `posts` array as `post` when navigating from `FutureMK` to `SignUpForMK`. Instead, try passing a single object from the `posts` array that corresponds to the post that was clicked, like this:

```
<Pressable 
    style={gStyle.FutureMKmoreDetails} 
    onPress={() => { navigation.navigate('SignUpForMK', { post: posts[index] }) }}
>
    <Text style={gStyle.FutureMKbtnTxt}>Подробнее</Text>
</Pressable>
```

In the code above, `index` is the index of the post on which the user clicked. You'll have to retrieve that value based on user input.

Also, make sure that the `post` object in your `SignUpForMK` component corresponds to the correct properties in the `posts` Firestore collection.

Finally, you need to handle cases where the `post` object is null or undefined, which can happen when the `SignUpForMK` component first renders. You can do this by adding a conditional check on `post` in your `SignUpForMK` component rendering.

You need to add these security rules to your Firebase project on the Firebase console. Here's how to do it:

1. Go to the Firebase console and select your project.
2. Click on "Firestore Database" in the left-hand menu.
3. Click on the "Rules" tab at the top.
4. Replace the existing rules with the rules I provided.
5. Click on the "Publish" button to publish the new rules to your database.

After publishing the new rules, your Firestore database should use the new security rules you defined.

Alternatively, you can also update your security rules programmatically using the Firebase CLI. You can find more information in the Firebase documentation.

If you find any errors in this description, please let me know the errors and the potential fixes (eg. bad English usage, etc.)
# SkypeOS

***SkypeOS*** is an extremely lightweight *(~280 MB)* Porteus Kiosk based operating system that utilizes Google Chrome and the [Skype Web App](https://web.skype.com) to create a grandparent-friendly exceptionally easy-to-use fullscreen environment for those who are afraid to use Windows.

After pressing the power button on the PC, Skype opens automatically without any user interaction required.

In the current SkypeOS configuration, access to every URL is blocked except the ones that are required for the usage of Skype and the login process. *(So grandparents should not be afraid of getting any viruses, etc...)*

SkypeOS can be installed permanently to your computer's hard drive / SSD, or can be booted and used with full functionality from a pendrive or any bootable, read-write capable non-optical storage media.

## System requirements

 - This is an X86_64 bit based linux distribution, so your CPU has to be based on 64 bit architecture.
 - RAM: 1 GB
 - Storage *(for our use case)*: 2 GB
 - Supports both UEFI and Legacy bios

Check the official [requirements here](https://porteus-kiosk.org/index.html#requirements) in detail.

*(Based on my experiences, 500MB of storage is enough.)*

## Installation

To install SkypeOS from the provided ISO, you will have to follow these steps:
1. Download the SkypeOS-[version_number].iso file. You can do that by clicking on the file name under Releases on the right of your screen, or by clicking [this]() link.

2. Now you'll need a tool to flash the SkypeOS image onto your flash drive/hard drive.
	I recommend [balenaEtcher](https://etcher.balena.io), because it's free and provides a clean, beginner-friendly user interface. Alternatively, you can use Rufus or the *dd* utility if you're using linux.
	The usage of a flashing software is pretty straightforward. You'll have to select the downloaded .iso, the target device, and click 'Flash!'.
	If you'd like to use a PC only for SkypeOS, you'll have to flash the provided ISO file *directly* to the main storage of the PC. Or you can execute a manual installation if you'd like to use an installer instead of directly flashing the premade ISO.

3. Boot the target PC from the flashed storage media. You can commonly select a bootable device by pressing the DEL or F12 key on your keyboard while you're starting up the computer.

4. Log into Skype and use it.

	Now, even after switching off the PC by pressing the power button and rebooting it, the user will remain logged into their Skype account. This is made possible through full persistence, ensuring that login activities are saved to the storage media." In this manner, once logged in, the user can use the OS without the need for a keyboard.

## Manually configured installation

In case you'd like to have full control over the configuration, follow these points:
1. Download the Porteus Kiosk installer from its [official site](https://porteus-kiosk.org/download.html), and create a bootable installation media.
2. Boot your PC from the flash drive, and select your preferred internet connection method.
3. Select Google Chrome as a browser *(Skype for web doesn't work with it's full functionality in Firefox.)*
4. Load the configuration file from *another* flash drive, or make your own config with the wizard. If you'd like to modify the configuration parameters manually, check the documentation for them [here](https://porteus-kiosk.org/parameters.html). Take a look at SkypeOS's [config settings]() for reference.
5. Select your storage, and install it.
Note that you won't have custom background with this solution.

## FAQ

1. *No sound / Webcam is not recognized.*
\- Use manual installation, and select a default sound output and/or microphone input during the installation process.
2. *PC boots successfully, but Skype doesn't show up*
\- Check if you've correctly plugged in the Ethernet cable into your PC. For wireless internet connection you'll have to perform a manual installation.

The description provided is largely well-written and clear, but there are a few areas that could be improved for better clarity and correctness. Here are the suggested corrections and potential fixes:

1. In the first paragraph, the phrase "grandparent-friendly exceptionally easy-to-use fullscreen environment" could be better structured as "an exceptionally easy-to-use, grandparent-friendly fullscreen environment". Adding a comma after "easy-to-use" provides better readability.

2. The phrase "So grandparents should not be afraid of getting any viruses" could be rephrased for formality and clarity: "This configuration minimizes the risk of virus infections, offering peace of mind for users."

3. In the "System requirements" section, the phrase "for our use case" might be unnecessary. It could be removed to maintain focus on the general system requirements: "Storage: 2 GB".

4. The line "(Based on my experiences, 500MB of storage is enough.)" should be rephrased to maintain formality and objectivity: "However, experience has shown that 500MB of storage may suffice for the minimal requirements."

5. In the "Installation" section, the placeholder [this]() suggests that there should be a link provided. Make sure to either insert the correct link or remove the placeholder if a direct link will not be provided.

6. The sentence "The usage of a flashing software..." could be improved for grammatical consistency: "Using flashing software is pretty straightforward; you'll need to select the downloaded .iso, the target device, and then click 'Flash!'."

7. In the fourth point of the "Installation" section, the last sentence could be clarified: "This persistent feature ensures that upon reboot, the user will remain logged into their Skype account, eliminating the need for a keyboard on subsequent uses."

8. Under "Manually configured installation," the fourth point contains a small mistake: "*Skype for web doesn't work with it's full functionality in Firefox.*" The correct possessive "its" should be used: "*Skype for web doesn't work with its full functionality in Firefox.*"

9. In the "FAQ" section, add a space after the hyphens for better readability:

   1. *No sound / Webcam is not recognized.*
   \- Use the manual installation and select [...]
   
   2. *PC boots successfully, but Skype doesn't show up.*
   \- Check if you've correctly plugged in the Ethernet cable [...]

10. In the last sentence of the same section, "For wireless internet connection, you'll have to perform a manual installation," ensure consistent pluralization: "For a wireless internet connection, you'll have to perform a manual installation."

Overall, these changes should help to improve the clarity, formality, and correctness of the description.

2. Is this a good fix? This configuration minimizes the risk of getting viruses, offering peace of mind for virus-fearing elderly users.
4. This way? \**(However, experience has shown that 500MB of storage can be suffice.)*

Making these adjustments ensures that the writing is grammatically correct and clear.

Your revision is understandable, but the phrase "is suffice" is grammatically incorrect. The word "suffice" is a verb, so it doesn't require "is" before it. A better way to phrase it would be:

"My experience has shown that 500MB of storage suffices."

or, to make it even more clear and grammatically correct:

"In my experience, 500MB of storage suffices."

This statement is concise, clear, and grammatically sound.
I'm uploading the missing link file as a release to GitHub. What should I write to release notes? It's the first ever release.

When creating your first release notes for the initial release on GitHub, it's essential to provide users with a clear and concise summary of what the release contains, its main features, and any important notes or acknowledgments. Here's an example template you can use for your release notes:

---

# Release Notes for SkypeOS [version_number]

## Introduction

We are thrilled to announce the first official release of SkypeOS! SkypeOS is a lightweight, user-friendly operating system designed to provide a seamless Skype experience on desktop computers. This release comes with a host of features aimed at making communication easier for those who prefer a simple, straightforward computing environment.

## What's New

- **Auto-Start Skype:** Skype now opens automatically at system startup, requiring no user interaction.
- **Enhanced Security:** Access to URLs is restricted by default, ensuring secure and worry-free usage.
- **Dual Boot Mode Compatibility:** Supports UEFI and Legacy BIOS boot options.
- **Streamlined Installation:** Bootable via USB or as a permanent installation on hard drives / SSDs.

## Installation

1. Download the SkypeOS-[version_number].iso file.
2. Use the recommended [balenaEtcher](https://etcher.balena.io) for a hassle-free setup or choose from other flashing tools like Rufus or `dd` if on Linux.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to install SkypeOS on your desired storage media.

*For detailed installation procedures and system requirements, please refer to the guidance provided in the README section.*

## System Requirements

- 64-bit CPU
- Minimum 1 GB RAM
- Minimum 2 GB Storage (500MB may suffice for minimal requirements, based on our testing)

## Known Issues

*No known issues at this time. Should you encounter any problems, please report them using the Issues tab.*

## Acknowledgments

A special thanks to all the contributors and the Porteus Kiosk community for the foundational work that made SkypeOS possible.

## How to Contribute

We welcome contributions! To contribute to SkypeOS, please read our contributing guidelines or directly submit pull requests.

## Feedback

Your feedback is precious to us. If you have any comments or issues, please open an issue in our GitHub repository.

Thank you for trying out SkypeOS. We look forward to hearing about your experience!

---

Remember to customize the [version_number] and other placeholders as appropriate for your release. It's also good practice to check for consistency with your project's existing documentation and naming conventions.

There was an error creating your Release: tag name can't be blank, tag name is not well-formed, published releases must have a valid tag.

When creating a new release on GitHub, it's important to follow certain guidelines regarding the tag name, which is used to track different versions of the software. Here's what you need to ensure:

1. **Tag Name Can't Be Blank**: You must provide a tag name for your release. This usually follows semantic versioning, for example, `v1.0.0`, `v1.0.1`, `v2.0.0`, etc.

2. **Tag Name Must Be Well-Formed**: Ensure that the tag name does not contain spaces or special characters that GitHub does not accept. Stick to alphanumeric characters and dots for versioning (for example, `v1.0.2`).

3. **Published Releases Must Have a Valid Tag**: Before you can publish the release, the tag you enter must not already exist unless you're updating an existing release, and it must follow GitHub's standards for tag names.

Here is how to properly create a release tag on GitHub:

- Navigate to the repository where you want to create a release.
- Click on the "Releases" section on the right side of the repository page.
- Click "Draft a new release" or "Create a new release."
- In the "Tag version" field, input a new and unique tag that follows semantic versioning (e.g., `v1.0.0`).
- Ensure that the tag name is appropriate and does not contain invalid characters.
- Fill out the rest of the release form, including the release title and description.
- Once all fields are filled out correctly, click "Publish release" at the bottom of the page.

Make sure you are adhering to these guidelines when creating your release, and if you're planning to attach binaries or additional resources, don't forget to upload them before publishing.
I want to design a logo for this SkypeOS. How should I do it? How should a logo of an operating system look like?

Designing a logo for an operating system, such as your SkypeOS, involves both creative and strategic planning. A good logo serves as the visual identity of your product and helps differentiate it from competitors. Follow these steps to design an effective logo for SkypeOS:

### Understand Your Brand:
Get a deep understanding of the ethos behind SkypeOS. Think about the values it represents, its functionality, and its target audience (in this case, making technology accessible for the elderly).

### Consider Logo Types:
There are generally a few types of logos you could consider:

- **Wordmarks:** A text-only logo, which is often the name of the product or brand (e.g., Google).
- **Lettermarks:** Similar to wordmarks but usually consists of initials or abbreviations (e.g., HP for Hewlett-Packard).
- **Brandmarks:** A logo that contains a symbol without text, which represents the brand through an image or icon (e.g., the Apple logo).
- **Combination Marks:** A combination of both text and symbol/icon (e.g., Microsoft Windows).

### Brainstorm Ideas:
Reflect on the features of SkypeOS and come up with concepts that you feel represent its essence. For example:

- Simplicity and ease of use (which could be represented by a clean and straightforward design).
- The communication aspect (an icon related to messaging or video calling, such as a speech bubble or video camera icon).
- The integration with Skype (elements of the Skype logo could be carefully incorporated to reflect this relationship).

### Sketch Initial Concepts:
Hand-draw a variety of ideas on paper. Don't worry about perfection at this stage, focus on translating your ideas into visual form.

### Create Digital Designs:
Choose a few of the best sketches and start to create them digitally using vector graphic software like Adobe Illustrator or free alternatives like Inkscape or Gravit Designer. Make sure to keep the design scalable and recognizable at various sizes.

### Choose Your Colors:
Select colors that resonate with your intended user base and enhance the identity of SkypeOS. Light blue, for example, is associated with trust and reliability and is also the color most associated with the Skype brand.

### Typography:
If your logo includes text, choose a typeface that reflects the characteristics of SkypeOS, such as accessibility and user-friendliness. The font should be legible at different sizes and clearly convey your OS's identity.

### Feedback & Refinement:
After creating a few strong contenders, get feedback from potential users, other designers, and stakeholders. Use this feedback to refine your designs.

### Finalize the Design:
Choose the logo that best represents SkypeOS, ensuring it works well across different mediums such as your website, app, or promotional materials.

### Legal Considerations:
Before finalizing your logo, make sure to do a trademark search to ensure the design doesn't infringe on any existing trademarks. It might also be beneficial to register your logo as a trademark to protect your brand identity.

Remember, a good OS logo should be:

- Simple: Easy to recognize and remember.
- Versatile: Scalable and effective across various mediums and applications.
- Relevant: Reflective of the operating system's purpose and core values.
- Distinctive: Unique enough to stand out from competitors.

Once you've settled on a final design, you can introduce it to your community and incorporate it into your branding efforts, always ensuring consistency across all your platforms.

conversation.content: how to use env files in react app? give exapmle?

In a React app, you can use environment variables or ".env" files to store configuration data that shouldn't be hardcoded into your app.

Here's an example of how to use `.env` files in a React app:

1. Create a `.env` file in your project's root directory. This file should contain environment variables in the following format:

```
REACT_APP_API_KEY=your_api_key
REACT_APP_BASE_URL=https://api.example.com
```

Note that environment variable names must start with `REACT_APP_` to be used in a React app.

2. In your React code, you can access these environment variables like this:

```
const apiKey = process.env.REACT_APP_API_KEY;
const baseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_BASE_URL;
```

3. You can also use environment variables in your `.env` file to dynamically set content in your app, like the title of a page:

```
REACT_APP_PAGE_TITLE=My App
```

And then in your React code:

```
document.title = process.env.REACT_APP_PAGE_TITLE;
```

where to put env file when I have repo with client nad api. Two repos

When you have two separate repositories, one for your client and one for your API, you should have an individual `.env` file in each repository.

The `.env` file for your client should be located in the root directory of the client repository, and likewise for the API repository. 

Each `.env` file should contain environment variables specific to the respective repository.

For example, in your client repository `.env` file you could define variables related to the frontend such as the API endpoints like this:

```
REACT_APP_API_URL=http://localhost:4000/api
```

In your API repository `.env` file you could define variables related to the backend such as database connection settings like this:

```
DATABASE_URL=postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/mydb
```

By having separate `.env` files for each repository, you ensure that configuration data is kept separate and organized, making it easier to maintain and update.
how to use react-dotenv?

`react-dotenv` is a library that makes it easy to use environment variables in a Create React App project. Here's how you can use `react-dotenv` in your Create React App project:

1. Install `react-dotenv` as a development dependency by running the following command:

   ```
   npm install --save-dev react-dotenv
   ```

2. Create a `.env` file in the root of your project and add environment variables to the file, prefixing all variable names with `REACT_APP_`. For example:

   ```
   REACT_APP_API_KEY=myapikey
   REACT_APP_BASE_URL=http://localhost:3001
   ```

3. In your app's entry point (usually `src/index.js` or `src/index.tsx`), include the following:

   ```javascript
   import { config } from 'dotenv';
   config();
   ```

   This loads the environment variables from the `.env` file into Node.js's process.env object and makes them available in the app.

4. In your app component or wherever you want to use environment variables, import the environment variables using `process.env`. For example:

   ```javascript
   const apiKey = process.env.REACT_APP_API_KEY;
   const baseUrl = process.env.REACT_APP_BASE_URL;
   ```

   You can then use these variables in your application.

Note: If you have already started your development server, you need to restart it for the changes to take effect.

By using `react-dotenv` you can manage your environment variables more easily and avoid hardcoding sensitive data in your application.

In our Tunecore vs Distrokid head-to-head comparison below we’ll talk about who they are, what they each do and what makes each company special.

We’ll help you decide what the best music distribution service is for your next music release.

In one of our featured guides, we showed you exactly how to upload music to Spotify and other streaming platforms, step-by-step.

But in this article, we’re going to help you decide which is better. What’s the best choice for your upcoming music release – you’ll get our complete take on Distrokid vs Tunecore in 2024. 

These are the two most popular services for getting your music everywhere but they’ve each got their strengths and weaknesses.

Spoiler Alert – this is our preferred distributor for getting your music to all the platforms/stores/outlets in the market.

Why?

Let’s talk about it…

Article Table of Contents

i. Video Overview
ii. Quick Comparison Chart

2. Differences Between the Two Companies

2.3 Payout Differences

4 Is Distrokid Better Than Tunecore

Quick Comparison Chart
Tunecore	Distrokid
Pricing	9/10 – Unlimited releases starting at $14.99	8/10 – Unlimited releases starting at $19.99
Basic Service	9/10 – 150+ store reach, high-value-added opportunities for artists	9/10 – 150+ store reach, decent “bells and whistles” extras
Premium Addons	7/10 – Mostly a ONE TIME fee (YT Ad Rev, Pub Admin), not a lot of addons available	7/10 – Lots of paid add-ons that can get expensive fast (paid PER RELEASE)

OVERALL SCORE	8.75/10	7.75/10

Click to Get Unlimited Music Releases!
What are Tunecore or Distrokid All About?
Both of these distribution companies offer independent artists the ability to sell and stream their music through all of the major online platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, Tidal and many more.

Tunecore Logo
Make no mistake, both companies are a solid choice to distribute your music with, but in our opinion Tunecore is the better option.

Not only have they represented some of the biggest artists in the world, like Russ, the Brooklyn, NY-based company was started back in 2005 while their competitor DK arrived on the scene in 2013.

Originally, though, they were just an “add-on” service to the music social network Fandalism and became it’s own company in 2015. So these guys have about 10 more years of experience, relationships and track record than Distrokid.

They also have offices all over the world and direct partnerships with the digital stores where your music will live. Distrokid is a smaller (and newer) outfit, but recently they started an initiative with record labels to help discover new talent (for a “finders fee,” of course).

Comparing Differences Between the Companies
Both companies offer the same sort of music distribution services in general. But when comparing, you should know each company has a few “extras” that may sway you in one direction or another.

The other main points of difference between the two competitors are their pricing structures and artist payout details.

— Related Content: Read Our Full Tunecore Review or DistroKid Review —

Pricing Differences
Before the summer of 2022, TuneCore used to be a much more expensive option, charging you PER RELEASE as oppsed to DistroKid’s “unlimited releases” model.

So these guys used to be the much cheaper option.

Distrokid Logo
But NOW, TuneCore is actually the MOST affordable option and they offer the same “unlimited releases” model that DistroKid pioneered.

They also offer a FREE tier membership, but you only get to release music to social networks – no Spotify/Apple Music/Tidal. To get your music on streaming services, their memberships start at $14.99 and go up to $49.99 (per year) depending on how many advanced features you want or artists you plan to release music for.

DK allows for an unlimited number of releases also with 3 main options – Musician ($19.99 per year), Musician Plus ($35.99 per year) and Label ($79.99 per year). The lower account allows you to release music for 1 artist, the Musician Plus plan allows for up to 2 artists and the label plan allows for up to 5 artists. If you need to release more than 5 different artists, you’ll be charged more on a scale depending on your needs.

You’re able to distribute an unlimited number of different artists (or an unlimited number of artist names, if you make different types of music), with the highest priced option ($49.99 per year).

Why DistroKid Wasn’t REALLY Cheaper than TuneCore in the Past
It’s also important to note that while a comparison makes it seem like Distrokid is cheap up-front, once you started to add extras (which all cost extra, too) it could start to get kind of pricey. This is stuff like having your music added to new stores as they open up, or having your music recognizable by Siri or Shazam, or even YouTube’s content ID.

For example, to get all the addons your first release would cost $84.86 on the regular “Musician” plan, and each additional single would cost $64.87 while each additional album you release (10 tracks) would cost $112.78.

Hundred Dollar Bills Covering a Floor
Got a cover song? That’s another $12. Oh and they also take 20% of your YouTube ad revenue if you get the YouTube Content ID addon.

Now that doesn’t mean TuneCore doesn’t have addons – their Sync Licensing service costs $75. And both companies take a commission on YouTube monetization.

Let’s talk more about the basic service and these addons both companies offer.

Service Differences
The main service of both companies is basically the same – they’ll get your music on all the major music streaming and sale platforms on the internet (150+ platforms). They also both offer analytics/tracking for your sales, etc. Finally, the upload process and options available to you are basically the same for both companies.

The differences in service come into focus, however, when you look beyond the “bread-and-butter” functionality.

Artist Support
Flat out, TuneCore has MUCH better customer service and support. They’re a decade older and have so many more offices/employees, so when you have an issue or need questions answered, you can easily get ahold of someone and get things resolved.

The Artist Support Team works 7 days a week. They take this shit seriously and reply within 1 business day. They also answer DM’s on social, and even have phone support if needed.

DistroKid’s support is… less optimal. Sure you can reach out (if you can find their contact method buried in their FAQ), but it’s not the best experience. Response times are slow and not always super helpful (but that’s just speaking from personal experience).

They also have a more helpful blog for aspiring artists and also offers partner discounts on products/services that musicians may find helpful (like product manufacturing, for example).

Added Value Services
Distrokid has some cool additional features they claim, like instantly getting you a “blue check” on Spotify, letting you upload your lyrics to certain platforms and they backup your music in case you lose your master recordings.

But in my opinion, those are kind of “meh” bells and whistles that don’t really mean much but sound cool. The one feature I DO really love that DistroKid offers exclusively is the ability to upload MQA/Master quality audio for Tidal.

Collection of Music Streaming Platform Logos
DistroKid really is just a budget “get your music on streaming sites and music stores” without a lot else. That’s not a knock – they’re still a great company.

But now they’re not even the cheapest option anymore.

But TuneCore is a bit “above and beyond” when it comes to the value added services.

For example, if you take advantage of their Music Publishing Admin add-on, your music is automatically considered TV/Film/Ad/Game sync opportunities they come across.

What’s more is that they also try and bring on new opportunities for their artists too – like their new Rewards program which lets artists unlock VIP masterclass sessions to help grow their career, get discounts and more. They’re always trying to offer their artists added value through different programs.

Click Here to Get All Your Music On Streaming Platforms Quickly and Easily

Premium Add-Ons
There are also some major differences in the add-on services offered by both companies. On first glance, DistroKid kind of wins in this area – they offer some pretty cool bells and whistles. But the trick is that some of the important ones are already included in TuneCore’s pricing, no added cost.

We touched briefly on the “addons” earlier in this post, so let’s flesh that out first.

DistroKid offers the following paid addons for your releases:

Shazam & Siri Recognition – for $0.99/song/year you can have your song “Shazam-able” or recognizable by Siri on iOS devices.
Store Maximizer – for $7.95/album/year you can ensure your music will be added to any NEW platforms that emerge
YouTube Content ID – for $4.95/single or $14.95/album PER YEAR (and an additional 20% cut of any ad revenue) you can ensure you get the credit if any of your music is used in a YouTube video
Cover Song Licensing – for $12/single/year you can easily license any existing song covers you want to release.
Tidal Master/MQA – for $8.99/single or $17.99/album, you can make sure an audiophile-quality master recording is uploaded to Tidal
Leave a Legacy – for $29/single or $49/album you can ensure that even if you don’t renew your membership, your music will remain on all the platforms.
Social Phone – for $12.99/month you can use the platform for Text Message Marketing to your fanbase.
Tunecore also has some paid addons artists may find useful:

Music Publishing + Sync Licensing – $75.00 ONE TIME fee and they will make sure you get paid your publishing anytime your music is used/played, even if you don’t know about it. You’ll also be eligible for sync opportunities for your music.
YouTube Ad Revenue – Now included with paid subscriptions and similar to DistroKid’s Content ID Service (they will also take a 20% cut of any ad revenue from YouTube)
TuneCore Social – FREE or $10.99 PER MONTH (pro version) gets you access to they company’s own social media management tool where you can edit photos, post to all your socials from one place, use special filters/text/stickers, and get deep insights/analytics on how well you’re marketing your music (including historical reports).
All in all, both companies have some pretty useful addons that serious artists will want to take advantage of. Tunecore beats Distrokid by a little bit – their social tool is better, and they handle publishing administration for artists.

And some of the stuff you need to “add-on” with DistroKid, is already included with your release. But in other ways (like Tidal MQA upload, for example), you’d need to go with Distrokid.

Differences in Payouts to Artists
This is where things get REALLY interesting when comparing Distrokid vs Tunecore.

Both companies pay out all of the royalties and sales they collect to the artists – you get 100% of what they collect.

But that’s not the full story here.

TuneCore, thanks to their dominance in the industry, is able to negotiate directly with music platforms. Most other distribution companies can’t do that. What that means for you as an artist is that you get 100% OF WHAT THE STORE PAYS OUT.

Since companies like DistroKid aren’t able to work directly with stores, they work with middlemen (in DistroKid’s case, they work with a company called Merlin to collect payouts). Unfortunately the middlemen take a cut before sending out the payments to the company.

So yes, DistroKid pays out 100% of the money they receive from Merlin – but they don’t receive 100% of what the stores pay out.

So in essence, TuneCore’s payouts to artists are better. In fact, in their history, they’ve paid out over $2,000,000,000.00 to artists. (Yup, that’s 2 BILLION dollars).

Try Them Out Today!

Frequently Asked Questions
Can I Use Distrokid and Tunecore at the Same Time?
Yes, there should be no problems doing this, but it is best to stick to one company so you only have one place to worry about managing. You may run into problems making sure all of your music is released under the same “artist profile” if you use more than one company to release your music. This can be fixed, but is a hassle. It can also become confusing when it comes to tracking how your music has performed. Our recommendation is to only use one service to release all of your music, although it isn’t 100% necessary to do so.

Which is Better – DistroKid or TuneCore?
Both companies have good offerings and are reliable places to get your music distributed. However, we prefer TuneCore as the better choice for most people since it’s been around longer, has a better payout structure and is now also the most affordable option to get your music out there.

Why Is TuneCore Better than DistroKid?
For us, we think TuneCore is the better option because it’s the older company with much better artist support, has more affordable pricing plans and works directly with stores to collect payments for artists.

Bottom Line – Who to Go With
So should you go with Distrokid or Tunecore?

I think it’s safe to say we’re BIG fans of TuneCore for all the reasons above.

But is Tunecore better than Distrokid?

I have personally used DistroKid to release music in the past and it was fine, but I am planning on sticking with TuneCore for certain future releases.

From their customer support, to their higher payouts to artists and the more valuable extras that come with the service, and now with their better pricing – they’re just the best option when choosing between the two. And that’s why they’re our #1 recommended service when it comes to independent music distribution services.

Again, Both are great companies that offers a good service. But TuneCore beats all competitors in the areas that matter to us. If you’re releasing your music soon, go with TuneCore.

Oh, by the way, we’ve partnered with them! So take advantage and get your music out there into the world today!

If you have music that’s ready to be released, I highly recommend you use TuneCore to do it – they’re an affordable way to release unlimited music to Spotify, Apple Music, Tidal and more!

Thanks for reading our complete head-to-head comparison of Tunecore and Distrokid. We hope you found it helpful in making your decision.

Go Back to “Music Business” Home

conversation.content: write a telegram bot that deletes all chat participants on command

As of my knowledge cutoff date in March 2023, Telegram Bot API does not provide a direct method for a bot to mass remove all members from a group chat or channel. The removal of participants from a group or channel is generally a sensitive action, and Telegram's API restricts bots from having such extensive capabilities that can be easily abused.

However, I can guide you on how to create a simple Telegram Bot using Python that listens for a specific command and removes a single participant as an example. This action can only be performed if the bot has administrative privileges in the group or channel and the 'ban users' permission. Keep in mind banning multiple users rapidly can be seen as spam-like behavior and might lead to limitations or a ban of the bot by Telegram.

Before we start, make sure you've:

1. Created a bot with BotFather and got the token.
2. Installed Python and the Python-telegram-bot library on your system.
3. Made your bot an admin of your group with the 'ban users' permission.

Here's a simple Python script using the `python-telegram-bot` library as an example:

```python
from telegram.ext import Updater, CommandHandler, MessageHandler, Filters
from telegram.error import BadRequest

# Replace 'YOUR_TOKEN' with your Bot's API token
TOKEN = 'YOUR_TOKEN'

    bot = context.bot
    chat_id = update.message.chat_id
    user_id = update.message.text.split(' ')[1]

    try:
        # Assuming bot has the necessary permissions, it can kick a user
        bot.kick_chat_member(chat_id, user_id)
        update.message.reply_text('User removed!')
    except BadRequest as e:
        update.message.reply_text(f'Error: {e.message}')

def main():
    # Create the Updater and pass it your bot's token.
    updater = Updater(TOKEN, use_context=True)

    # Get the dispatcher to register handlers
    dp = updater.dispatcher

    # Register the /deleteparticipant command handler
    dp.add_handler(CommandHandler('deleteparticipant', delete_participant, pass_args=True))

    # Start the Bot
    updater.start_polling()

    # Run the bot until you press Ctrl-C
    updater.idle()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

from telegram.ext import Updater, CommandHandler
from telegram import BotCommand
import logging

# Enable logging
logging.basicConfig(format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
                    level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

# Bot token from BotFather
TOKEN = 'YOUR_BOT_TOKEN'

# Command to trigger the removal of all participants
def remove_all_command(update, context):
    bot = context.bot
    chat_id = update.message.chat_id
    user_id = update.message.from_user.id
    
    # Make sure the user executing the command is an admin
    user_status = bot.get_chat_member(chat_id, user_id)
    if user_status.status not in ['administrator', 'creator']:
        update.message.reply_text("You need to be an admin to use this command.")
        return
    
    # Loop through all chat members and kick them one by one
    for member in bot.get_chat_members_count(chat_id):
        try:
            bot.kick_chat_member(chat_id, member.user.id)
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Error removing user {member.user.id}: {e}")
            continue

    update.message.reply_text("All chat participants have been removed.")

def error_handler(update, context):
    """Log errors caused by updates."""
    logger.warning('Update "%s" caused error "%s"', update, context.error)

def main():
    """Start the bot."""
    updater = Updater(token=TOKEN, use_context=True)

    # Get the dispatcher to register handlers
    dispatcher = updater.dispatcher

    # Register handlers
    dispatcher.add_handler(CommandHandler('removeall', remove_all_command))

    # Log all errors
    dispatcher.add_error_handler(error_handler)

    # Start the Bot
    updater.start_polling()
    updater.idle()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
```

Replace `'YOUR_BOT_TOKEN'` with your actual bot token. ```python
import telebot
from telebot import types
from telebot.apihelper import ApiException

TOKEN = 'YOUR_BOT_TOKEN'  # Replace with your bot token
bot = telebot.TeleBot(TOKEN)

# Dictionary to hold lists of users seen in each chat
chat_member_ids = {}

@bot.message_handler(func=lambda m: True, content_types=['text', 'new_chat_members'])
def collect_user_ids(message):
    chat_id = message.chat.id
    user_id = message.from_user.id

    # Initialize if no entry exists for this chat
    if chat_id not in chat_member_ids:
        chat_member_ids[chat_id] = set()
        
    # Add the user to the chat's set of user_ids
    chat_member_ids[chat_id].add(user_id)

    # Handle new chat members joining
    if message.content_type == 'new_chat_members':
        for new_user in message.new_chat_members:
            chat_member_ids[chat_id].add(new_user.id)

@bot.message_handler(commands=['removeall'])
def remove_all_users(message):
    chat_id = message.chat.id
    user_id = message.from_user.id

    # Check if the bot is an admin and the user is also an admin
    bot_admin_status = bot.get_chat_member(chat_id, bot.get_me().id)
    user_admin_status = bot.get_chat_member(chat_id, user_id)

    # Check if the bot and the user who sent the command have admin rights
    if bot_admin_status.status in ['administrator', 'creator'] and user_admin_status.status in ['administrator', 'creator']:
        # Iterate through all user_ids in this chat and kick each one
        for member_id in chat_member_ids.get(chat_id, []):
            try:
                # Skip kicking the bot itself and the admin who issued the command
                if member_id != bot.get_me().id and member_id != user_id:
                    bot.kick_chat_member(chat_id, member_id)
            except ApiException as e:
                print(f"API error: {e}")
                continue
        bot.send_message(chat_id, "All members have been removed.")
    else:
        bot.reply_to(message, "You need both admin permissions and the 'can_restrict_members' admin right to use this command.")

# Polling method to keep the bot running
bot.polling(none_stop=True)
```

Here's a simplified example of how you can create a bot to promote users to admin status. This script will promote the first 40 users who send a message after the command is issued:

```python
import asyncio
from aiogram import Bot, Dispatcher, types, executor

API_TOKEN = 'YOUR_BOT_TOKEN'
MAX_ADMINS = 40

# Initialize bot and dispatcher
bot = Bot(token=API_TOKEN)
dp = Dispatcher(bot)

promotion_queue = []

@dp.message_handler(commands=['promote'])
async def cmd_promote(message: types.Message):
    if message.from_user.id != message.chat.id:
        # Resetting promotion queue
        promotion_queue.clear()
        await message.reply("Send a message to become an admin. Only the first 40 will be promoted!")

@dp.message_handler(lambda message: not message.from_user.is_bot and message.from_user.id not in promotion_queue)
async def queue_user_for_promotion(message: types.Message):
    if len(promotion_queue) < MAX_ADMINS:
        promotion_queue.append(message.from_user.id)
        # Promoting the user to admin with default permissions
        permissions = types.ChatAdministratorRights(
            is_anonymous=False, can_manage_chat=True, can_delete_messages=True,
            can_manage_voice_chats=True, can_restrict_members=True, can_promote_members=False,
            can_change_info=True, can_invite_users=True, can_post_messages=True,
            can_edit_messages=True, can_pin_messages=True
        )
        await bot.promote_chat_member(message.chat.id, message.from_user.id, permissions)
        await message.reply(f"Congratulations {message.from_user.full_name}, you've been promoted to admin!")
    if len(promotion_queue) == MAX_ADMINS:
        await bot.send_message(message.chat.id, "We now have 40 new admins!")

if __name__ == '__main__':
    executor.start_polling(dp, skip_updates=True)
```

Replace `'YOUR_BOT_TOKEN'` with your actual bot token. The bot will promote the first 40 users who send a message in the group after the `/promote` command is issued. The promoted users will not be able to add new admins, as the `can_promote_members` right is set to `False`.
